programme.title: ELEPHANT IN THE ROOM
programme.desc: A former, female boxing champion and her business partner coach are mentoring two teenage girls, best friends through their non-profit gym.

programme.title: Inns of Color
programme.desc: Inns of Color showcases a collective of five uniquely-themed African American owned bed and breakfasts."

programme.title: Something Necessary
programme.desc: Joseph, a troubled young gang member who participated in the countrywide violence is drawn to Anne and her farm seemingly in search of redemption. Both he and Anne need something that only the other can give to allow them to shed the painful memories of their past and move on â€“ but will either of them find it?

programme.title: JERMAINE
programme.desc: Jermaine Johnson is a 36-year old father of three and husband to his high-school sweetheart, Lawanna.

programme.title: THE BEAST
programme.desc: An ordinary day at a Zulu cultural village. Shaka, their star performer, expresses his frustrations to his co-workers as he sits on display for tourists. On this day he reaches the end of his tether and his protest takes on Shakespearian proportion.

programme.title: The Third Space EP1
programme.desc: The coffee shop is the perfect setting to have rich and in depth conversations with some of the most influential change-makers in the Bay Area and beyond. TTS has an entirely Black and people of color crew in front of and behind the camera.

programme.title: The Third Space EP2
programme.desc: The coffee shop is the perfect setting to have rich and in depth conversations with some of the most influential change-makers in the Bay Area and beyond. TTS has an entirely Black and people of color crew in front of and behind the camera.

programme.title: The Third Space EP3
programme.desc: The coffee shop is the perfect setting to have rich and in depth conversations with some of the most influential change-makers in the Bay Area and beyond. TTS has an entirely Black and people of color crew in front of and behind the camera.

programme.title: THIRD SPACE EP5
programme.desc: The coffee shop is the perfect setting to have rich and in depth conversations with some of the most influential change-makers in the Bay Area and beyond. TTS has an entirely Black and people of color crew in front of and behind the camera.

programme.title: THE PIROGUE
programme.desc: In Moussa Toure’s powerful epic fiction film, a group of 30 men sail to Europe in a pirogue, facing the sea - and the possibility of never reaching their destination - in exchange for the myth of a better life in Europe.

programme.title: The Man Who Mends Women
programme.desc: Doctor Mukwege is internationally known as the man who mends thousands of women who have been raped during the 20 years of conflicts in the East of the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

programme.title: Gershwin And Bess
programme.desc: Details of the operaâ€™s inception and the cast, as well as Ms. Brown's controversial run-ins with discrimination, offer an illuminating historical account. This was one of Ms. Brownâ€™s final interviews. Filmed through the talented lensing of Director of Photography Henry Adebonojo, this lively and engaging conversation covers musicianship, self-reliance, race, and beauty."

programme.title: Pahokee - The Rabbit Hunt
programme.desc: Three award-winning short films that exquisitely capture the Pahokee community, a small black Florida town.

programme.title: PALM TREES DOWN 3RD ST.
programme.desc: While searching for her father, Nikki meets her half-sister Winter for the first time on the streets of San Francisco.

programme.title: AFROKONS
programme.desc: Sila Apiseh, a young woman, decides to run for office. She engages in a battle to empower women and give hope to youth in her country, AFROKONS.

programme.title: WALK WITH ME
programme.desc: Walk With Me follows three women who use theater to inspire, stir and animate our democracy. While at work in prisons, schools and community centers, the film reveals that one person â€“ one artist â€“ can make a difference.

programme.title: A DIOS MOMO
programme.desc: Little Obdulio sells newspapers on the street to bring home a few coins for his family. His life is altered when he befriends the night watchman of the newspaper, a magical "Maestro," who will not only introduce him to reading, but also teach him the real meaning of life, using the lyrics of the "Murgas" under the spell of the God MoMo during the mythical nights of the Uruguayan Carnival.

programme.title: MATERNALLY YOURS Episode 1
programme.desc: In this dramedy mini-series, 20-something Sheena is ready to move on from her small city of Alexandria, LA and head to New Orleans.
